context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Olney: Parts of baseball are disappearing before our very eyes
context_meta.summary: Buster Olney ESPN Senior Writer Close Senior writer ESPN Magazine/ESPN.com Analyst/reporter ESPN television Author of "The Last Night of the Yankee Dynasty" Follow on Twitter The remodeled dugouts in Wrigley Field have shifted the sightlines for Cubs manager Joe Maddon as he goes about his work each day. In the old home dugout -- the sanctuary for generations of Cubs, from Ernie Banks to Kerry Wood -- Maddon had an unencumbered view of his third-base coach. But in the new dugout, Maddon sometimes has to peer around or over a railing to see Brian Butterfield, who is in his first year coaching third for Chicago, and Maddon says he's still trying to get comfortable in his 2018 spot. And the box

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Yankees take momentum into Baltimore
context_meta.summary: BALTIMORE -- The New York Yankees are coming to Baltimore to start a four-game series Thursday night after a strong performance against the World Series champion Houston Astros. New York took two of three from Houston, including a 5-3 victory in the series finale Wednesday. The Yankees scored 11 runs in the last two games of the series and won Tuesday night despite making five errors. In Wednesday's game, struggling Giancarlo Stanton went 1-for-2 and told the New York Post that he's not going to make any monster changes in his swing. He is hitting .248 with 11 homers and 29 RBIs but hasn't yet found the right kind of consistency. "It's too much of an adjustment to make in the middle of a season,"

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Major League Baseball roundup: Rays' Eovaldi dazzles in return
context_meta.summary: Nathan Eovaldi threw six no-hit innings in his first start since 2016, and Rob Refsnyder belted a three-run home run Wednesday, lifting the visiting Tampa Bay Rays to a third win in three days over the Oakland Athletics, 6-0. Making his Rays debut, Eovaldi (1-0) was pitching for the first time since undergoing elbow surgery, which cost him the entire 2017 season, and a follow-up procedure that stalled the start of his 2018 season. The 28-year-old walked the second batter he faced, Matt Chapman, before retiring 17 in a row to carry a no-hitter and a 4-0 lead through six innings.

context_meta.summary: Alcides Escobar is a bad hitter. Even if you love the guy, you've got to admit that much. And putting a bad hitter second in the lineup...yeesh. Unforced error. context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Cubs' Maddon seeks clarity after 2nd slide spat
context_meta.summary: Jesse Rogers ESPN Staff Writer Jesse joined ESPN Chicago in September 2009 and covers the Chicago Cubs for ESPNChicago.com and ESPN Radio 1000. Follow on Twitter PITTSBURGH -- Another attempted takeout slide, this time at second base, provided an opportunity for Chicago Cubs manager Joe Maddon to express his opinion again -- albeit in a sarcastic tone -- about the slide rules which have dominated the conversation between the Cubs and Pittsburgh Pirates this week. The scenario unfolded when Pirates pitcher Joe Musgrove slid hard into second base in the bottom of the fourth inning, popping back up and into second baseman Javier Baez, who was about to attempt a throw to first for a double play.

context_meta.title: Tigers score 5 after Ohtani's departure, beat Angels 6-1
context_meta.summary: Shohei Ohtani was rolling along for five innings against the Detroit Tigers on Wednesday night. With Ohtani out of the game, Jose Iglesias' two-run single keyed a five-run sixth inning and the Tigers went on to a 6-1 victory. Ohtani, starting for the first time since May 20th, allowed one run and three hits in five innings.

context_meta.title: How the Rangers found Isiah Kiner-Falefa and the prophetic words he told the scout who signed him
context_meta.summary: First in a series on the Rangers' MLB draft history.  SEATTLE -- He is the most recent Rangers draft "success" story. Who led them to the heady, gritty, spunky Isiah Kiner-Falefa? Marcus Doi. You may not have heard of Marcus Doi, and you certainly won't find him in the Rangers media guide. He never played professionally. And doesn't scout. But back in 2011-12, Doi, a catcher, was considered the best prospect in Hawaii. If you were scouting Hawaii, you had to see Doi. And Doi just happened to be Kiner-Falefa's teammate at Mid-Pacific Institute in Honolulu. The scouts came to see Doi, but one, in particular, saw something else. "I saw this kid, 5-2, maybe 120 pounds," said Steve Flores, the Rangers

context_meta.summary: The ''Wow'' moment didn't come when Austin Meadows received the news the Pittsburgh Pirates were calling him up to the majors. Long considered the eventual heir to Andrew McCutchen before a series of injuries at Triple-A slowed his progress, Meadows has been a revelation.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Reyes abruptly departs from season debut after four innings
context_meta.summary: The Cardinals' young starter, who is back from elbow surgery after missing 15 months, was abruptly removed from the game after throwing four innings. He needed 73 pitches to get his 12 outs, and there was a time in his four innings that saw his velocity drop with each passing fastball. That trend corrected after the meeting and Reyes was able to throw 96 mph and 95 mph fastballs to close out his appearance. Reyes struck out the first batter he faced on three pitches, and he would go on to strike out one more batter. In the second inning he walked two and hit another batter to increase his pitch count quickly. The Cardinals do want to avoid stress innings by the righthander, and those have previously

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Tensions mount between Cubs and Pirates in 2-1 loss
context_meta.summary: By the time the Cubs face the Pirates at Wrigley Field on June 8, manager Joe Maddon hopes the perceived ambiguity regarding the slide rule is cleared up after an incident involving pitcher Joe Musgrove and second baseman Javier Baez caused another bench-clearing incident Wednesday night. Maddon asked for a crew-chief review after Musgrove slid hard and grazed Baez in an attempt to break up a potential double play in the third inning even though Baez didn't attempt to throw to first base. After a review, it was determined the play was “non-reviewable” because Baez didn't attempt to throw. “Again, I'm not going to get into it,” said Maddon, who said he didn't have an issue with Musgrove's slide.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Gorkys Hernandez is suddenly really good
context_meta.summary: The 2018 San Francisco Giants entered spring training with a gazillion outfield options. Not necessarily good options, but options nonetheless. They signed Austin Jackson, fresh off a very strong offensive campaign, and traded for Andrew McCutchen. They still had veteran Hunter Pence, coming off of a decent finish to the 2017 season. Mac Williamson and Austin Slater appeared ready for bigger roles, Jarrett Parker was out of options, and Steven Duggar was forcing the front office's hands. And to top it all off, in came Gregor Blanco on a camp invite. There really wasn't a lot of room for Gorkys Hernandez, who seemed to represent so much of what went wrong a year ago. Not that Hernandez was actively

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Ronald Torreyes: An Unfortunate, but Necessary, Demotion
context_meta.summary: A side effect of being a very good baseball team is that roster decisions are often difficult; the Yankees and their fans experienced this firsthand when the team recently sent Ronald Torreyes to Triple-A in order to make room for Greg Bird's powerful left-handed bat. Bird's addition is an undeniable benefit to the big-league team, but Torreyes' continue presence since the start of last season has made many fans ask the question of if his demotion was the right decision. Realistically, the Yankees had three options with Bird's wings finally healed: demote Torreyes, demote Tyler Austin, or drop their pitching staff down from 13 to 12 members. Some fans have called for DFA'ing Neil Walker instead,

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Major League Baseball roundup: Yanks rally in 9th, beat Astros in 10th
context_meta.summary: Brett Gardner hit the game-tying home run with one out in the bottom of the ninth, and rookie Gleyber Torres singled in a run with two outs in the 10th, lifting the New York Yankees to a 6-5 victory over the Houston Astros on Tuesday night at Yankee Stadium. After the Yankees stranded two in the ninth against Chris Devenski, rookie Miguel Andujar ripped a double down the left field line to start the winning rally. Six pitches later, Torres won it by lining Brad Peacock's 2-2 pitch in front of right fielder George Springer.

context_meta.summary: Jordan Hicks can't explain where the gas comes from. If he's being honest, the St. Louis Cardinals rookie flamethrower doesn't really want to. The kind that allowed Hicks to bypass Double-A and Triple-A entirely on his way to The Show.
